page.title: 01Overview of the Kilby Block
page.content: This block is a typical example of rural south Leicestershire. The majority of the land, some 3/4 is Intensively Managed Grassland used for either grazing or production of winter feed.The block does contain many trees although there are only two small woods the majority are to be found in hedges or isolated in fields. The block contains part of the Midland Railway and the Grand Union Canal in addition to various roads. The remaining 1/4 of the land is dominated by either the village of Kilby or Wistow Hall and grounds. There are also small parts of other villages Fleckney and Newton Harcourt. The population is very small most in Kilby village the rest in isolated farmhouses or the parts of the other villages. ?
